alert.note: Alert for Dodge; Douglas; Saunders; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 11 at 4:31PM CDT until June 11 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...SOUTHEASTERN DODGE...NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS AND NORTHEASTERN SAUNDERS COUNTIES... At 430 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles northeast of Valley, or 8 miles west of Bennington, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Washington, southeastern Dodge, northwestern Douglas and northeastern Saunders Counties, including the following locations... Camp Eagle, Camp Cedars, Fremont Lakes State Recreation Area and Ames. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for east central Nebraska. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
